Text:
Immediately after the match ends I'm almost carted off
to the medical office, but I escape at the first chance I
get.

(That was close. It wouldn't do to have anyone
see that I don't actually have a scratch on me.)
(Then I really would get sliced to ribbons.)

I leave via the contestant's entrance
and proceed along an empty street.

Now, where to show off my other 33 techniques...
Maybe some good chance will pop up,

but what would be really awesome
is if "that" happened again...
U-Um, excuse me!
Huh?

Suddenly, a student I don't know speaks to me. She's
a pretty, pink haired girl wearing a science academy
uniform. Have I seen her somewhere before?

(Who is she again...? I don't really know anyone from
the science section.)
Are...your wounds okay?

J-Just barely... I managed to avoid anything too
serious...I think.
I decide to sit down on a nearby terrace for now.
I'm glad to hear it. I watched your match.
O-Oh really? Thanks.

I don't often watch battles, but I thought it was really
cool how you kept getting back up.
Uh, it was cool...?
Yes...
She blushes a bit as she nods.

(That's one way to look at it... But I guess some
girls are just like that.)
Um, here...
She timidly offers me a small parcel.
What's this?
I baked them for you, as thanks...

(Thanks...? For what? Maybe showing her my slick
side character moves?)
Thanks.
I accept since she went through all the trouble.
I-If you don't mind, I'd like to be friends.
Friends?

(I don't really get why, but I suppose it can't
hurt.)
Sure.

Aside from a few certain exceptions, I try to go
through life without embarrassing women.
Really?
Yay!
I did it!
Father, I made a friend!
Huh?

The girl was looking at a tall man with his white
hair slicked back. I'd seen this thin fella before.

(Lutheran Barnett, assistant principal of the Academy
of Science...)

(...A master swordsman as skilled with a pen as with
a blade. He's even won the Bushin Festival before.)

(In order to keep on being an extra, I keep an eye on
leading characters that I need to avoid. So if she's
calling him Father, that means this girl is...)
(Sherry Barnett...)

(Definitely a named character... I don't have much
to do with the kids from the Academy of Science,
so I guess I let my guard down.)

(Based on my own investigations, she has it in her to
be the most central character in the Academy of
Science.)

(The kind who provides the protagonist with sound
advice or unravels some big mystery in the story.) ã€€

(Or makes some powerful equipment to help beat a
boss. That's how I imagined her.)

(Since I didn't think I'd need to go up against any
of the science academy students, I honestly kinda
thought she didn't matter and forgot all about her.)
Does it hurt somewhere after all?
Oh, no. No, I'm fine.

Cid Kagenou, was it? Are you sure those wounds aren't
bothering you?

M-Miraculously, no... Oh, but...maybe she went easy
on me?

Yes, Rose would certainly be one to show mercy.
Still, you should get a doctor to look you over.
Understood?
Oh, yes, sir. Maybe on the way home...

(No chance of that since any doc checking me over
would see that I'm unharmed...)

This girl is totally devoted to her studies. Why,
even now she's hard at work on a request from
the Knight Order to analyze an artifact.
It follows then that she doesn't have many friends.
Father, please!
The assistant principal laughs and continues.

She's here doing all this now, but she went through a
lot in the past.

So please be her friend, if you don't mind. Consider
it a request from a father.

Lutheran's face is earnest, and next to him Sherry
smiles uncomfortably.

(Uh, I'm just an extra, so I can't go around hanging
with named characters...)
(...Not like I can actually say that here.)
...Yes.
Well, I'm going to head to the hospital.

(For now I'll use my injuries as an excuse to rest
for a few days and keep my distance.)

As it turns out, the cookies had a simple flavor that
was quite nice.
